fullProgramDescription: The Dance major at UC San Diego offers students a comprehensive education in dance technique, history, and criticism, as well as choreography and performance. The program is designed to provide students with a deep understanding of dance as an art form and its various cultural and historical contexts. Students work with faculty to develop their technical skills, creative expression, and critical thinking.
shortProgramDescription: The Dance B.A. program at UC San Diego provides a rigorous foundation in dance technique, history, and choreography, preparing students for careers in the field or further study.
classHighlights: Technique and Performance: Students take a range of technique courses in ballet, modern, and other styles, as well as performance courses that allow them to apply their technical skills in a practical setting. Courses include Dance101-102,201-202, and301-302.
Choreography and Improvisation: Students learn choreographic techniques and principles, as well as improvisation skills, through courses such as Dance120,220, and320.
Dance History and Criticism: Students study the history of dance, including its cultural and social contexts, through courses such as Dance140,240, and340.
Dance and Technology: Students explore the intersection of dance and technology through courses that incorporate video, digital media, and other technologies.
learningOutcomes: Develop technical proficiency in multiple dance styles
Understand the cultural and historical contexts of dance
Apply dance techniques and principles to various performance settings
additionalInformation: Students must declare the major through the Department of Theatre and Dance and meet with a departmental advisor to plan their course of study.
